cards.name: Vodalian Soldiers
cards.flavor:
"Vodalian rank is displayed by the colors and patterns of their skin. Beware the color red; that is the badge of the empress's favor."
—Corbio, pearl diver

cards.name: Wall of Air
cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
When no falcons fly, beware the sky.
—Femeref aphorism
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
Flying

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."
—William Blake,
The Marriage of Heaven and Hell
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Wind Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor:
" . . . When the trees bow down their heads,
The wind is passing by."
—Christina Rossetti,
"Who Has Seen the Wind?"
cards.originalText:
Flying
Wind Spirit can't be blocked by only one creature each combat.

cards.name: Zur's Weirding
cards.text:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, they reveal it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.

rulings.text: If someone pays the cost, then the card was never drawn or discarded. It just gets put into the graveyard directly from the library.
This is a continuous replacement effect that modifies a draw.
If a spell or ability causes more than one card to be drawn, draw the cards one at a time and deal with this replacement before drawing the next card.

When using Dredge with this, you have two choices. You can immediately replace the draw with Dredge, or you can apply Zur's Weirding's replacement. If the latter, you first resolve Zur's Weirding's ability, then if you're going to draw the card, decide whether or not to replace that draw with Dredge.

cards.originalText:
Players play with their hands revealed.
Whenever a player would draw a card, instead reveal it. Any other player may pay 2 life to put that card into its owner's graveyard. If no one does, that player then draws the card.

cards.name: Abyssal Hunter
cards.text: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature. Abyssal Hunter deals damage equal to Abyssal Hunter's power to that creature.
cards.flavor: Some smiles show cheer; some merely show teeth.

rulings.text: The ability can target an already tapped creature.

cards.originalText: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature. Abyssal Hunter deals damage equal to its power to that creature.

cards.name: Abyssal Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player chooses and discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Agonizing Memories
cards.text: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"An innocent man died because of my anger. That knowledge will haunt me for all eternity."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put those cards on top of that player's library in any order you choose.

cards.name: Ashen Powder
cards.text: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor:
"What you call decay, I call ripening. You'll gain no sustenance from this harvest."
—Kaervek
cards.originalText: Put target creature card from one of your opponents' graveyards into play under your control.

cards.name: Blight
cards.text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.
cards.originalText: When enchanted land is tapped, destroy it.

cards.name: Blighted Shaman
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{T}, Sacrifice a swamp: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Blood Pet
cards.text: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B}.
cards.flavor: "You are wrong," Volrath said. "I do not hate the living. They often prove quite useful to me." And then he laughed.

rulings.text: Because combat damage resolves immediately after it is assigned, you cannot sacrifice Blood Pet in between assigning and dealing combat damage. The last chance you have to sacrifice it before combat damage is dealt is during the Declare Blockers step.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Bog Rats
cards.text: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.
cards.flavor: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.
cards.originalText: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable if defending player controls a swamp.)

cards.name: Coercion
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
A rhino's bargain
—Femeref expression meaning
"a situation with no choices"
cards.originalText: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Derelor
cards.text: Black spells you cast cost {B} more to cast.
cards.flavor:
"Strength it has, but at the cost of a continuous supply of energy. Such failure can bear only one result."
—Execution order of Endrek Sahr,
master breeder
cards.originalText: Your black spells cost {B} more to play.

cards.name: Doomsday
cards.text: Search your library and graveyard for five cards and exile the rest. Put the chosen cards on top of your library in any order. You lose half your life, rounded up.

rulings.text: If your graveyard and library combined contain five or more cards, you must choose five cards from among them. You can't choose to find fewer than that.
If your graveyard and library combined contain fewer than five cards, all of those cards will wind up in your library.

cards.originalText: Search your library and graveyard for five cards of your choice and remove the rest from the game. Put the chosen cards on top of your library in any order you choose. You lose half your life, rounded up.

cards.name: Dread of Night
cards.text: White creatures get -1/-1.
cards.flavor:
"These moonless, foreign skies keep me in thrall. Dark whispers echo in the night, and I cannot resist."
—Selenia, dark angel
cards.originalText: White creatures get -1/-1.

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons.

cards.name: Dry Spell
cards.text: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor:
"Wherever water is lacking, all things suffer."
—Autumn Willow
cards.originalText: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Enfeeblement
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
cards.flavor:
"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.

cards.name: Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore
cards.text:
Non-Eye creatures you control can't attack.
Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore can't be blocked except by Walls.
cards.flavor: The highway of fear is the shortest route to defeat.
cards.originalText:
Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore can't be blocked except by Walls.
Except for Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore, creatures you control can't attack.

cards.name: Fallen Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Angels are simply extensions of truth upon the fabric of life—and there is far more dark than light." —Baron Sengir

rulings.text: Can sacrifice itself.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fatal Blow
cards.text: Destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"What is crueler? To let a wound of the heart fester, or to simply cut it out?"
—Crovax

rulings.text: Fatal Blow can't target a creature that hasn't been dealt damage this turn.

Fatal Blow cares whether the creature had been dealt damage during the turn, not whether there is still damage on it. If the creature had regenerated, causing all damage to clear, Fatal Blow can still target and destroy it.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Fear
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and black creatures.

cards.name: Feast of the Unicorn
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+0.
cards.flavor:
"Could there be a fouler act? No doubt the baron knows of one."
—Autumn Willow
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +4/+0.

cards.name: Feral Shadow
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Forbidden Crypt
cards.text:
If you would draw a card, return a card from your graveyard to your hand instead. If you can't, you lose the game.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere, exile that card instead.

rulings.text: It will replace itself being sent to the graveyard, and exile itself.
The second ability is a replacement effect, not a triggered ability. The card never gets to the graveyard.
The "if you can't" in the first ability refers to putting the card in your hand, as well as being unable to choose a card. Thus, if you can't choose a card during resolution, you lose the game.
If more than one card is being drawn due to a single effect, apply the replacement as if the cards were being drawn one at a time.

cards.originalText:
Whenever you would draw a card, instead return target card from your graveyard to your hand. If you can't, you lose the game.
Whenever a card would be put into your graveyard, instead remove that card from the game.

cards.name: Gravebane Zombie
cards.text: If Gravebane Zombie would die, put Gravebane Zombie on top of its owner's library instead.
cards.originalText: When Gravebane Zombie would be put into a graveyard from play, instead put Gravebane Zombie on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: When Gravedigger comes into play, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Greed
cards.text: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"There is no calamity greater than lavish desires. There is no greater guilt than discontentment. And there is no greater disaster than greed."
—Lao Tsu, Tao Te Ching, (trans. Chan)
cards.originalText: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

cards.name: Hecatomb
cards.text:
When Hecatomb enters the battlefield, sacrifice Hecatomb unless you sacrifice four creatures.
Tap an untapped Swamp you control: Hecatomb deals 1 damage to any target.

rulings.text: If you have less than 4 creatures, you do not partially sacrifice. You pay 4 creatures or none.
The sacrifice is done as a triggered ability just after it enters the battlefield. It is not done on casting.
You choose whether to sacrifice creatures or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice Hecatomb. You can choose to not sacrifice creatures if you no longer control this card on resolution.

cards.originalText:
When Hecatomb comes into play, you may sacrifice four creatures. If you don't, sacrifice Hecatomb.
Tap an untapped swamp you control: Hecatomb deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Hidden Horror
cards.text: When Hidden Horror enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you choose whether to sacrifice the creature or perform the other action. If you can't perform the other action, then you must sacrifice the creature.
If the creature is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, you may still perform the action if you want.

cards.originalText: When Hidden Horror comes into play, choose and discard a creature card from your hand. If you don't, sacrifice Hidden Horror.

cards.name: Howl from Beyond
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Infernal Contract
cards.text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
cards.flavor:
"But I signed nothing!"
—Taraneh, Suq'Ata mage

rulings.text: If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

cards.originalText: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Dead
cards.text:
When Kjeldoran Dead enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.
cards.flavor:
"They shall drink sorrow's dregs. They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

rulings.text: The sacrifice is a triggered ability and not a cost.
When Kjeldoran Dead's enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, if you don't control any other creatures, you must sacrifice Kjeldoran Dead itself.

cards.originalText:
When Kjeldoran Dead comes into play, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.

cards.name: Leshrac's Rite
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has swampwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
"Bind me to thee, my soul to thine. I am your servant and your slave. Blood for blood, flesh for flesh, Leshrac, my lord."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gains swampwalk. (It's unblockable if defending player controls a swamp.)

cards.name: Lost Soul
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: Her hand gently beckons, she whispers your name—but those who go with her are never the same.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable if defending player controls a swamp.)

cards.name: Mind Warp
cards.text: Look at target player's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.
cards.flavor: The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.

rulings.text: The target player decides what order to put the cards in the graveyard. You decide which cards, but they do the discarding.

cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards them.

cards.name: Mischievous Poltergeist
cards.text:
Flying
Pay 1 life: Regenerate Mischievous Poltergeist.
cards.flavor:
"The past is a ghost that haunts you from the moment it exists until the moment you don't."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText:
Flying
Pay 1 life: Regenerate Mischievous Poltergeist.

cards.name: Necrosavant
cards.text: {3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: The ability is activated while this card is in the graveyard.

cards.originalText:
{3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to play.
Play this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: As the poisoned land spreads, so does the nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare's power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare's ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of swamps you control.

cards.name: Painful Memories
cards.text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Put that card on top of that player's library.
cards.flavor:
"It is terrible how one brief action can live forever in memory."
—Jolrael
cards.originalText: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Put that card on top of that player's library.

cards.name: Perish
cards.text: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Pestilence
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.
Note that "until end of turn" effects wear off after "at the beginning of the end step" triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.

cards.originalText:
At end of turn, if there are no creatures in play, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Python
cards.flavor:
"How can you claim the gods are merciless when they robbed the snake of its limbs to give the other creatures a sporting chance?"
—Hakim, Loreweaver

cards.name: Rag Man
cards.text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals their hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.flavor: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"
cards.originalText: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Look at target opponent's hand. That player discards a creature card at random from it. Play this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Razortooth Rats
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."
—Crovax
cards.originalText: Razortooth Rats can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and black creatures.

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Sengir Autocrat
cards.text:
When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, create three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens.
When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.

rulings.text: Sengir Autocrat's last ability exiles all Serf tokens, not just the Serf tokens its first ability created.

If Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield while its first ability is on the stack, its second ability triggers and exiles any Serf tokens that happen to be on the battlefield, and then its first ability resolves and gives you three Serf tokens.

cards.originalText:
When Sengir Autocrat comes into play, put three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens into play.
When Sengir Autocrat leaves play, remove all Serf tokens from play.

cards.name: Strands of Night
cards.text: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a Swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"I have seen the night torn into thin darkling strips and woven into shapes too bleak for dreams."
—Crovax
cards.originalText: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Stromgald Cabal
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.
cards.flavor: When the alliance between Balduvia and Kjeldor deprived Stromgald of easy victories, its agents were forced to fuel their rituals with their own flesh.
cards.originalText: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.

cards.name: Stupor
cards.text: Target opponent discards a card at random, then discards a card.
cards.flavor:
There are medicines for all afflictions but idleness.
—Suq'Ata saying
cards.originalText: Target opponent discards a card at random from his or her hand, then chooses and discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Syphon Soul
cards.text: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.originalText: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Vampiric Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets."
—Shauku, Endbringer

rulings.text: The "shuffle and put the card on top" is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.

cards.name: Zombie Master
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
cards.flavor: He controlled the zombies even before his own death; now nothing can make them betray him.
cards.originalText: All Zombies gain "{B} Regenerate this creature" and swampwalk. (They're unblockable if defending player controls a swamp.)

cards.name: Aether Flash
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, Aether Flash deals 2 damage to it.
cards.flavor:
"You can't get there from here. Well, you can—it just won't be fun."
—Ertai, wizard adept

rulings.text: This is not a targeted ability, so it deals damage to creatures that can't be targeted by spells and abilities.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play, Æther Flash deals 2 damage to it.

cards.name: Anaba Bodyguard
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor:
"Not all minotaurs are tribal. Some are freelance."
—Eron the Relentless
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Anaba Shaman
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"The shamans? Ha! They are craven cows not capable of true magic."
—Irini Sengir
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Balduvian Barbarians
cards.flavor:
"Barbarian raids were a concern to those living in the northwest provinces, but the skyknights never dealt with the problem in a systematic way. They thought of the Balduvians as an 'amusing model' of their forebears' culture."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

cards.name: Balduvian Horde
cards.text: When Balduvian Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.

rulings.text: You choose whether to discard or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice this card. You can choose to not discard even if you no longer control this card on resolution.

cards.originalText: When Balduvian Horde comes into play, discard a card at random from your hand. If you don't, sacrifice Balduvian Horde.

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Fire never dies alone.
cards.originalText: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Boil
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.flavor:
"The fishers will throw out their nets and draw them back filled with dust."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText: Destroy all islands.

cards.name: Burrowing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has mountainwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gains mountainwalk. (It's unblockable if defending player controls a mountain.)

cards.name: Conquer
cards.text:
Enchant land
You control enchanted land.
cards.flavor:
"Why do we trade with those despicable elves? You don't live in forests, you burn them!"
—Avram Garrisson,
Leader of the Knights of Stromgald
cards.originalText: You control enchanted land.

cards.name: Crimson Hellkite
cards.text:
Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana on X.
cards.flavor:
"Dragonfire forged me a warrior."
—Rashida Scalebane
cards.originalText:
Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana this way.

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.name: Fervor
cards.text: Creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)
cards.flavor:
"If your blood doesn't run hot, I will make it run in the sands!"
—Maraxus of Keld

rulings.text: If an attacking creature loses haste, perhaps because Fervor leaves the battlefield after attackers have been declared, it won't be removed from combat.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control gain haste. (They may attack and {T} the turn they come under your control.)

cards.name: Final Fortune
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
cards.flavor:
Want all, lose all.
—Zhalfirin aphorism

rulings.text: If you end up skipping the extra turn that is gained, you do not lose the game.
If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.originalText: Take another turn after this one. At the end of that turn, you lose the game.

cards.name: Fire Elemental
cards.flavor: Fire elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

cards.name: Firebreathing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Magic's only part of it, my friend. Diet does the rest."
—Suq'Ata trader

rulings.text: This ability can be activated by Firebreathing's controller, not the enchanted creature's controller (in case they're different players).
The ability affects whichever creature is enchanted by Firebreathing at the time the ability resolves. The bonus remains even if Firebreathing stops enchanting that creature.

cards.originalText: {R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fit of Rage
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Anger is fleeting; remorse is eternal."
—Karn, silver golem

rulings.text: The +3/+3 is also only until end of turn.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Flame Spirit
cards.text: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian chieftain
cards.originalText: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Flashfires
cards.text: Destroy all Plains.
cards.originalText: Destroy all plains.

cards.name: Giant Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
cards.flavor:
"O! it is excellent / To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous / To use it like a giant."
—William Shakespeare,
Measure for Measure
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

cards.name: Goblin Digging Team
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
cards.flavor:
"From down here we can make the whole wall collapse!"
"Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.

cards.name: Goblin Elite Infantry
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They talk a good fight.
cards.originalText: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or is blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Hero
cards.flavor:
"When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back!"
—Biggum Flodrot, goblin veteran

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok . . . ."

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.originalText: All Goblins get +1/+1 and gain mountainwalk. (They're unblockable if defending player controls a mountain.)

cards.name: Goblin Recruiter
cards.text: When Goblin Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Goblin cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.
cards.flavor: "Next!"

rulings.text: You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.originalText: When Goblin Recruiter comes into play, search your library for any number of Goblin cards you choose. Reveal those cards, then shuffle your library and put them on top of it in any order you choose.

cards.name: Goblin Warrens
cards.text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavor: "Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late." —Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

rulings.text: The token Goblins can be sacrificed to the Warrens to generate new Goblins.

cards.originalText: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Hammer of Bogardan
cards.text:
Hammer of Bogardan deals 3 damage to any target.
{2}{R}{R}{R}: Return Hammer of Bogardan from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.originalText:
Hammer of Bogardan deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
{2}{R}{R}{R}: Return Hammer of Bogardan to your hand. Play this ability only during your upkeep and only if Hammer of Bogardan is in your graveyard.

cards.name: Hulking Cyclops
cards.text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
cards.flavor: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.
cards.originalText: Hulking Cyclops can't block.

cards.name: Illicit Auction
cards.text: Each player may bid life for control of target creature. You start the bidding with a bid of 0. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and gains control of the creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: This is a life loss and not a life payment so you can bid more life than you have.

cards.originalText: Choose target creature. Each player may bid life for control of that creature. You begin the bidding at 0. Proceeding in turn order, each player may top the high bid. The auction ends when the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and gains control of the creature.

cards.name: Inferno
cards.text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: "Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead." —Jaya Ballard, task mage
cards.originalText: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Jokulhaups
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.originalText: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Lightning Blast
cards.text: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."
—Selenia, dark angel
cards.originalText: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Manabarbs
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

rulings.text: This card has a triggered ability that causes a separate effect for 1 point of damage each time a land is tapped for mana.
This ability is not a mana ability. It goes on the stack and can be responded to.
The ability will trigger each time a land is tapped for mana. Each ability is separate.

If any lands are tapped for mana while a player is casting a spell or activating an ability, Manabarbs's ability will trigger that many times and wait. When the player finishes casting that spell or activating that ability, it's put on the stack, then Manabarbs's triggered abilities are put on the stack on top of it. The Manabarbs abilities will resolve first.

On the other hand, a player can tap lands for mana, let the Manabarbs triggered abilities be put on the stack, and then respond to those abilities by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the spell or ability will resolve first.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Mountain Goat
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: Only the heroic and the mad follow mountain goat trails.
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk (This creature is unblockable if defending player controls a mountain.)

cards.name: Orcish Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

rulings.text: You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability doesn't resolve because the target is illegal.

cards.originalText: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Orcish Oriflamme
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.originalText: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Pillage
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Pyrotechnics
cards.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
cards.flavor:
"Hi!ni!ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me! / Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."
—Navajo war chant

rulings.text: The number of targets chosen for Pyrotechnics must be at least one and at most four. You choose how the damage is divided as you cast the spell, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.
If some but not all of Pyrotechnics's targets become illegal, you can't change the division of damage. Damage that would have been dealt to illegal targets simply isn't dealt.
If an effect creates a copy of Pyrotechnics, the number of targets and division of damage can't be changed. The effect that creates the copy may allow you to change the targets, however.

cards.originalText: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided any way you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Reckless Embermage
cards.text: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to itself.
cards.flavor: Many mages have been consumed by their work.
cards.originalText: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to itself.

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
cards.flavor:
"Flog and Squee / Up the tree / See the army / Flee, flee, flee."
—Goblin nursery rhyme/war cry

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.originalText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. You get an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase this turn.

cards.name: Sabretooth Tiger
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor:
"I fear anything with teeth measured in handspans!"
—Norin the Wary
cards.originalText: First strike
